sector_narrative: Removal of land mines and explosive remnants of war
description_narrative: Through demining, training and capacity development Danish Demining   Group, DDG, aims their phase out project 2013/2014 to improve the     humanitarian situation of the poorest region in Basra, southern Iraq, as well as contribute to socio-economic development. DDG will         continue the impact-led and community focused approach initiated in   2010, which was supported by Sida.

Genom minröjning, utbildning och kapacitetsutveckling syftar Danish   Demining Group, DDG, utfasningsinsats 2013/2014 till att bidra till   en förbättrad humanitär situation för de allra fattigaste och till en socio-ekonomisk utveckling i Basra, södra Irak. DDG fortsätter att    arbeta med en impact-styrd metod som utgår från lokala initiaitv som  inleddes 2010, och som erhöll stöd av Sida.
result_description_narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: 1. Reduce risks associated with the threat of landmines and other explosive remnants of war (ERW)
within the Shatt Al Arab District, situated in southern lraq in order to; 
Enhance community safety,
lmprove access to livelihoods,
Allow renewed economic activity and development,
Enable the wider enjoyment of basic human rights, and
Aid RMAC -S to fulfil their 2013-14 goals

2. Build and support an lraqi mine action NGO to meet this objective in the longer term.

Due to lack of cooperation from the Iraqi authorities, DDG did not reach their long-term objectives, or had difficulties measuring impact. In terms of m2 secured, the goals were reached. The local NGO was not put in place, as planned.
result_indicator_description_narrative: No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
